The breaking of the tables of stone was but a representation of the fact that Israel had broken the covenant which they had so recently made with God. 


                                   -111- 

It is a righteous indignation against sin, which springs from zeal for the glory of God, not that anger prompted by self-love or wounded ambition, which is referred to in the words of Scripture, "Be ye angry, and sin not" [Ephesians 4:26]. Such was the anger of Moses.
